Articles.Content:
removed all mods and bug still occurs..

Open KSP (either normal or X64 version), resume game, click on my Career save "Aug 16", click load, no reaction. 

Only change is before I click load, the main menu is greyed:

 

After I click load:

.

 

 

spamming the load button is unresponsive. still loads sandbox with no error. 

Put a fair dent in the tech tree on this save so would like to recover the file somehow... 

Any suggestions?

Could be a corrupt persistent save file. Back your career folder up somewhere (your career should be there : Kerbal Space Program\saves\AUG 16) and try this:

  • delete persistent.sfs (it's the corrupt file)
  • duplicate the most recent quicksave #xxx.sfs and rename it persistent.sfs
  • try loading your game (you may need to restart the game)
  • if you load a craft in the tracking station and hit F9, you MAY be able to restore your progress (the one you have lost when deleting the corrupt persistent.sfs file).
  • if it doesn't work, try with an older quicksave #yyy.sfs file...

You'll obviously loose some progress but you'll play again.

On 11/09/2016 at 7:31 PM, SnakyLeVrai said:

Could be a corrupt persistent save file. Back your career folder up somewhere (your career should be there : Kerbal Space Program\saves\AUG 16) and try this:

  • delete persistent.sfs (it's the corrupt file)
  • duplicate the most recent quicksave #xxx.sfs and rename it persistent.sfs
  • try loading your game (you may need to restart the game)
  • if you load a craft in the tracking station and hit F9, you MAY be able to restore your progress (the one you have lost when deleting the corrupt persistent.sfs file).
  • if it doesn't work, try with an older quicksave #yyy.sfs file...

You'll obviously loose some progress but you'll play again.

Thanks - worked a treat. 

Can't actually figure out what I lost, so its a win all round!

11 hours ago, Wright1 said:

Thanks - worked a treat. 

Can't actually figure out what I lost, so its a win all round! 

Prime SP2004 or Mprime are good tools to test if your machine (cpu and memory) is actually stable.
